REQ ID R0113977

Title: Data Scientist, Product Analytics
Description:
As a Data Scientist at Meta, you will shape the future of people-facing and business-facing products we build across our entire family of applications (Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, WhatsApp, Oculus). By applying your technical skills, analytical mindset, and product intuition to one of the richest data sets in the world, you will help define the experiences we build for billions of people and hundreds of millions of businesses around the world. You will collaborate on a wide array of product and business problems with a diverse set of cross-functional partners across Product, Engineering, Research, Data Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Finance and others. You will use data and analysis to identify and solve product development‚Äôs biggest challenges. You will influence product strategy and investment decisions with data, be focused on impact, and collaborate with other teams. By joining Meta, you will become part of a world-class analytics community dedicated to skill development and career growth in analytics and beyond.Product leadership: You will use data to shape product development, quantify new opportunities, identify upcoming challenges, and ensure the products we build bring value to people, businesses, and Meta. You will help your partner teams prioritize what to build, set goals, and understand their product‚Äôs ecosystem.Analytics: You will guide teams using data and insights. You will focus on developing hypotheses and employ a diverse toolkit of rigorous analytical approaches, different methodologies, frameworks, and technical approaches to test them.Communication and influence: You won‚Äôt simply present data, but tell data-driven stories. You will convince and influence your partners using clear insights and recommendations. You will build credibility through structure and clarity, and be a trusted strategic partner.

Data Scientist, Product Analytics Responsibilities:


Work with large and complex data sets to solve a wide array of challenging problems using different analytical and statistical approaches.
Apply technical expertise with quantitative analysis, experimentation, data mining, and the presentation of data to develop strategies for our products that serve billions of people and hundreds of millions of businesses.
Identify and measure success of product efforts through goal setting, forecasting, and monitoring of key product metrics to understand trends.
Define, understand, and test opportunities and levers to improve the product, and drive roadmaps through your insights and recommendations.
Partner with Product, Engineering, and cross-functional teams to inform, influence, support, and execute product strategy and investment decisions.


Minimum Qualifications:


A minimum of 6 years of work experience in analytics (minimum of 4 years with a Ph.D.)
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, a relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages (e.g. Python), and/or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R)
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience.


Preferred Qualifications:


Masters or Ph.D. Degree in a quantitative field.


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today‚Äîbeyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

$173,000/year to $242,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: AI Scientist
Description:
*Due to the sensitive nature of our work, U.S. citizenship is required*

Location: Fairfax, VA, - Nashua, NH, - Sunnyvale, CA, - El Segundo, CA or Remote (U.S.)

Perceptronics Solutions is a growing company that creates leading edge technologies in the domains of electronic warfare, unmanned systems, complex planning, intelligence analysis, and training. By combining innovative science, artificial intelligence / machine learning, and compelling design, we help our customers tackle the most difficult problems now faced by the US Department of Defense and security agencies, local governments, and corporate enterprises. We love a challenge and are always looking for motivated people to join our team! Perceptronics is a member of the Pacific Defense group of companies, and there is ample room for career growth.

Who are we looking for?

Perceptronics Solutions is seeking strong, enthusiastic candidates for the position of AI Research Scientist to join our research and development team. In this role, you will work with a small team of highly motivated scientists and engineers to apply cutting-edge AI algorithms to real-world problems and to deploy them to exciting software products for use by soldiers.

Your work will help us develop techniques for controlling swarms of UAVs, understanding the electronic battlespace, and improving planning for multidomain maneuvers. We are seeking candidates who are particularly interested in multi-agent systems, AI planning, sensor fusion, resource allocation, and adjustable autonomy. Candidates must be capable of adapting and extending state-of-the-art academic research to help solve DoD problems.

Candidates must love a challenge and enjoy working in a team environment.

Requirements

Minimum:


BS or MS (preferred) in Artificial Intelligence, Robotics, Computer Science, or related field
2-3 years of experience with developing AI autonomy algorithms or multi-agent algorithms. Experience with applications involving cooperative autonomous systems is preferred
Programming experience in Python, Java, C++, etc
Experience in developing and operationalizing systems that include advanced algorithmic components, such as Monte Carlo Tree Search, Particle Filters, Distributed Constraint Optimization and PetriNets
US Citizen and ability to obtain a security clearance required


Responsibilities:


Assist in literature reviews to identify possible solutions to a selected problem, including identifying strengths and weaknesses of various approaches
Participate in creative brainstorming on how various methods may be applied to problems of interest. Such as geolocation of RF emitters or enabling persistent surveillance of UAVs
Design, implement, and test prototype algorithms
Support algorithm integration into applications and software services
Evaluate performance of algorithms on selected problems related to coordination and control of multi-agent UAV teams
Communicate work in both written and verbal forms, both for internal and external consumption


Benefits

We offer competitive salaries, and great benefits including a top health insurance policy with employee‚Äôs premium 100% covered, a generous PTO policy, and flexible work schedule.

Perceptronics Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected factor.
Show more
HTML:
*Due to the sensitive nature of our work, U.S. citizenship is required*

Location: Fairfax, VA, - Nashua, NH, - Sunnyvale, CA, - El Segundo, CA or Remote (U.S.)

Perceptronics Solutions is a growing company that creates leading edge technologies in the domains of electronic warfare, unmanned systems, complex planning, intelligence analysis, and training. By combining innovative science, artificial intelligence / machine learning, and compelling design, we help our customers tackle the most difficult problems now faced by the US Department of Defense and security agencies, local governments, and corporate enterprises. We love a challenge and are always looking for motivated people to join our team! Perceptronics is a member of the Pacific Defense group of companies, and there is ample room for career growth.

Who are we looking for?

Perceptronics Solutions is seeking strong, enthusiastic candidates for the position of AI Research Scientist to join our research and development team. In this role, you will work with a small team of highly motivated scientists and engineers to apply cutting-edge AI algorithms to real-world problems and to deploy them to exciting software products for use by soldiers.

Your work will help us develop techniques for controlling swarms of UAVs, understanding the electronic battlespace, and improving planning for multidomain maneuvers. We are seeking candidates who are particularly interested in multi-agent systems, AI planning, sensor fusion, resource allocation, and adjustable autonomy. Candidates must be capable of adapting and extending state-of-the-art academic research to help solve DoD problems.

Candidates must love a challenge and enjoy working in a team environment.

Requirements

Minimum:

  • BS or MS (preferred) in Artificial Intelligence, Robotics, Computer Science, or related field
  • 2-3 years of experience with developing AI autonomy algorithms or multi-agent algorithms. Experience with applications involving cooperative autonomous systems is preferred
  • Programming experience in Python, Java, C++, etc
  • Experience in developing and operationalizing systems that include advanced algorithmic components, such as Monte Carlo Tree Search, Particle Filters, Distributed Constraint Optimization and PetriNets
  • US Citizen and ability to obtain a security clearance required

Responsibilities:

  • Assist in literature reviews to identify possible solutions to a selected problem, including identifying strengths and weaknesses of various approaches
  • Participate in creative brainstorming on how various methods may be applied to problems of interest. Such as geolocation of RF emitters or enabling persistent surveillance of UAVs
  • Design, implement, and test prototype algorithms
  • Support algorithm integration into applications and software services
  • Evaluate performance of algorithms on selected problems related to coordination and control of multi-agent UAV teams
  • Communicate work in both written and verbal forms, both for internal and external consumption

Benefits

We offer competitive salaries, and great benefits including a top health insurance policy with employee‚Äôs premium 100% covered, a generous PTO policy, and flexible work schedule.

Perceptronics Solutions is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, veteran status, or any other protected factor.

Title: Data Scientist, Product Analytics
Description:
As a Data Scientist at Meta, you will shape the future of people-facing and business-facing products we build across our entire family of applications (Facebook, Instagram, Messenger, WhatsApp, Oculus). By applying your technical skills, analytical mindset, and product intuition to one of the richest data sets in the world, you will help define the experiences we build for billions of people and hundreds of millions of businesses around the world. You will collaborate on a wide array of product and business problems with a diverse set of cross-functional partners across Product, Engineering, Research, Data Engineering, Marketing, Sales, Finance and others. You will use data and analysis to identify and solve product development‚Äôs biggest challenges. You will influence product strategy and investment decisions with data, be focused on impact, and collaborate with other teams. By joining Meta, you will become part of a world-class analytics community dedicated to skill development and career growth in analytics and beyond.Product leadership: You will use data to shape product development, quantify new opportunities, identify upcoming challenges, and ensure the products we build bring value to people, businesses, and Meta. You will help your partner teams prioritize what to build, set goals, and understand their product‚Äôs ecosystem.Analytics: You will guide teams using data and insights. You will focus on developing hypotheses and employ a diverse toolkit of rigorous analytical approaches, different methodologies, frameworks, and technical approaches to test them.Communication and influence: You won‚Äôt simply present data, but tell data-driven stories. You will convince and influence your partners using clear insights and recommendations. You will build credibility through structure and clarity, and be a trusted strategic partner.

Data Scientist, Product Analytics Responsibilities:


Work with large and complex data sets to solve a wide array of challenging problems using different analytical and statistical approaches.
Apply technical expertise with quantitative analysis, experimentation, data mining, and the presentation of data to develop strategies for our products that serve billions of people and hundreds of millions of businesses.
Identify and measure success of product efforts through goal setting, forecasting, and monitoring of key product metrics to understand trends.
Define, understand, and test opportunities and levers to improve the product, and drive roadmaps through your insights and recommendations.
Partner with Product, Engineering, and cross-functional teams to inform, influence, support, and execute product strategy and investment decisions.


Minimum Qualifications:


A minimum of 6 years of work experience in analytics (minimum of 4 years with a Ph.D.)
Bachelor's degree in Mathematics, Statistics, a relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience.
Experience with data querying languages (e.g. SQL), scripting languages (e.g. Python), and/or statistical/mathematical software (e.g. R)
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience.


Preferred Qualifications:


Masters or Ph.D. Degree in a quantitative field.


About Meta:

Meta builds technologies that help people connect, find communities, and grow businesses. When Facebook launched in 2004, it changed the way people connect. Apps like Messenger, Instagram and WhatsApp further empowered billions around the world. Now, Meta is moving beyond 2D screens toward immersive experiences like augmented and virtual reality to help build the next evolution in social technology. People who choose to build their careers by building with us at Meta help shape a future that will take us beyond what digital connection makes possible today‚Äîbeyond the constraints of screens, the limits of distance, and even the rules of physics.

Meta is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We do not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, transgender status, sexual stereotypes, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Meta participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations, as required by law. Please note that Meta may leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning technologies in connection with applications for employment.

Meta is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities in our recruiting process. If you need any assistance or accommodations due to a disability, please let us know at accommodations-ext@fb.com.

$173,000/year to $242,000/year + bonus + equity + benefits

Individual compensation is determined by skills, qualifications, experience, and location. Compensation details listed in this posting reflect the base hourly rate, monthly rate, or annual salary only, and do not include bonus, equity or sales incentives, if applicable. In addition to base compensation, Meta offers benefits. Learn more about benefits at Meta.

Title: Data Scientist (GenAI)
Description:
About Fusemachines

Fusemachines is a 10+ year old AI company, dedicated to delivering state-of-the-art AI products and solutions to a diverse range of industries. Founded by Sameer Maskey, Ph.D., an Adjunct Associate Professor at Columbia University, our company is on a steadfast mission to democratize AI and harness the power of global AI talent from underserved communities. With a robust presence in four countries and a dedicated team of over 400 full-time employees, we are committed to fostering AI transformation journeys for businesses worldwide. At Fusemachines, we not only bridge the gap between AI advancement and its global impact but also strive to deliver the most advanced technology solutions to the world.

About The Role

This is a remote, contract based role for 3 - 6 months with possibility of extension. As a Data Scientist, you will play a crucial role in designing, developing, and implementing Machine Learning models and Generative AI solutions. You will work closely with ML Engineers, Data Engineers, and other stakeholders to ensure our AI applications are robust, scalable, and impactful.

Roles And Responsibilities

Your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:


Own and develop Machine Learning solutions to solve unstructured, complex business problems
Maintain and optimize existing Machine Learning solutions and improve them with more efficient methods
Monitor models‚Äô performance in production to ensure the highest quality level, report on development status, identify risk areas and support the Data Science team
Build state-of-the-art & cost-efficient solutions leveraging GenAI models for multiple use cases (summarisation, classification, chatbots)
Perform statistical analysis on existing and new datasets to help SME stakeholders identify areas for improvement
Communicate technical solutions to non-technical stakeholders successfully
Research new methods and techniques in AI/ML to improve processes and methodologies


Required Skills

The individual applying for this role must have 2-4 years of experience as a Data Scientist building production-ready Machine Learning solutions.


Experience with common Machine Learning frameworks and methods and developing business-oriented data solutions (e.g., data mining, process optimization, predictive modeling)
Experience building GenAI solutions with LLMs and familiarity with both open-source and Proprietary LLMs
Proficiency in using Databricks for developing and managing machine learning workflows
A background in a quantitative discipline (Computer Science, Maths, Statistics, Engineering), or a PhD with a focus on quantitative methodologies. Don‚Äôt be afraid to apply for this role if you come from a different background, as long as you have relevant experience
Strong coding skills: Python (it‚Äôs a must), SQL, PySpark, and R are used across multiple projects
Hands-on experience with Machine Learning libraries such as Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, Keras, PyTorch, or H2O
Hands-on experience with LLMs to build RAG solutions using Hugging Face, LangChain, and/or OpenAI models
Problem-solving skills, critical thinking, and a creative mindset
Excellent written and verbal communication
Excellent organizational, problem-solving, and communication skills
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment and remain composed under pressure
A good level of English is expected (C1/C2)


Fusemachines is an Equal Opportunities Employer, committed to diversity and inclusion. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Scientist (all levels)
HTML:
Let's start with the role

At Kaizen, our aim is to make data driven decisions in order to automate our servicers while also focusing on offering tailored customer experiences. Our machine learning team is dedicated towards this mission by building a variety of models, from binary classification tasks up to recommendation systems. We focus on transforming business needs into production applications and we cover a wide range of business sectors utilizing different data types and handling a broad project diversity.

Our teams comprise of three different roles, data scientists, machine learning engineer and data engineers so that they include the full skillset to deliver projects to production.

We are currently looking for data scientists in all levels to join our teams. The role should combine strong knowledge of machine learning algorithms, analytical skills, experimental design etc. to support the model development process.

As a Data Scientist you will

  • Translate business requirements to machine learning problems;
  • Perform EDA and feature engineering;
  • Run comparative experiments for model training;
  • Implement best practices on model selection, parameter tuning etc.

What you‚Äôll bring

  • A background in Computer Science, Statistics, Math or related field;
  • Strong knowledge of machine learning algorithm and respective theory;
  • 2-8 years of hands-on experience in delivering machine learning models to production;
  • Knowledge of the Python machine learning ecosystem;
  • Experience with Spark (PySpark);
  • Solid software background in OOP;
  • Strong skills in teamwork, communication, and analytical thinking;
  • Fluency in English, both oral and written.

Nice to have

  • Experience with Azure / Databricks;
  • Knowledge of Deep learning;
  • Experience in recommendation systems.

#Artificial Intelligence (AI) #Machine Learning (ML) #Data Science (DS)

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Are you a brilliant new graduate, passionate about Big Data and Machine Learning? Do you think Artificial Intelligence is changing the world with groundbreaking innovation? Dive into Deep Learning algorithms and cutting-edge techniques to develop human-machine interaction.

Join Reply!




WHAT WE OFFER

A technological nirvana. At Reply, true innovation runs in our blood. We have a nerdy heart and we are proud of it. Cool tech stack, guaranteed hands-on experience, challenges, hackathons, table footballs and free coffee are already waiting for you.
A continuous learning experience. In Reply, what you know is never enough. Choose from internal webinars, learn from other Replyers and teach others what keeps you awake at night.
A structured career. The perfect path to your achievements. Now with a brand new Graduate Programme.




WHAT WE NEED

Academic background. With a brilliant Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or technical equivalent.
Teamwork mindset. In Reply, we believe in teamwork. Once here, your team will be your family and will guide you everywhere. We hope you will love it.
Curiosity and drive. We ask you to love what you do. And to always aim for excellence.




WHO WE ARE

Reply is a company that specialises in Consulting, Systems Integration and Digital Services with a focus on the conception, design and implementation of solutions based on the new communication channels and digital media. Reply partners with key industrial groups in defining and developing business models made possible by the new technological and communication paradigms such as Artificial Intelligence, Big Data, Cloud Computing, Digital Communication, the Internet of Things and Mobile and Social Networking.

Feel interested?

Title: Junior Research Data Scientist
Description:
Covisian S.p.A √® un gruppo internazionale , partner di oltre 150 clienti attraverso le sue 25.000 persone che operano in 38 sedi in 7 paesi diversi e un fatturato annuo di 400 milioni di euro circa. In Italia siamo presenti con 13 sedi su tutto il territorio e gestiamo oltre 50 clienti leader in diversi settori. Lo facciamo coniugando interesse collettivo e logiche di mercato, forte dinamismo e cultura dell‚Äôinclusivit√†, performance e accountability. Se vuoi entrare a far parte della nostra squadra consulta le nostre posizioni aperte e trova l‚Äôopportunit√† pi√π adatta a te!

Posizione:

Stiamo ricercando profili di Junior Research Data Scientist da integrare attivamente nel team di R&D formato da professionisti che mettono a disposizione le proprie competenze ed esperienze sul campo per formare e rendere indipendenti le nuove risorse. Il processo di formazione avverr√† sia tramite corsi specialistici, sia tramite l'applicazione diretta delle conoscenze sul campo, in cui i research data scientist junior, sotto la supervisione delle figure pi√π esperte, acquisiranno sempre pi√π indipendenza esecutiva e progettuale.

Responsabilit√† Specifiche:


Gestire i dati dall'estrazione all'analisi descrittiva.
Reperire e comprendere la letteratura scientifica per identificare difficolt√† e opportunit√† relative ai task specifici.
Partecipare attivamente alla creazione di modelli discriminativi, generativi e predittivi di machine learning, deep learning, AI e GenAI.
Comunicare i risultati dei modelli discriminativi, predittivi e generativi agli stakeholder e al personale tecnico e non tecnico, interno o esterno.
Lavorare sotto la supervisione delle figure senior per acquisire competenze e indipendenza esecutiva e progettuale.


Requisiti:

Skill e esperienza richiesta:


Laurea magistrale/specialistica in Computer Science, Fisica, Matematica, Chimica, Statistica e discipline STEM in generale.
Buona conoscenza del linguaggio di programmazione Python e delle librerie rilevanti (Pandas, Numpy, Pytorch, Tensorflow, Plotly, Seaborn, etc.).
Conoscenza dei fondamentali e degli strumenti di statistica descrittiva e inferenziale.
Capacit√† e disponibilit√† a lavorare in team.
Propensione al continuo aggiornamento sulle nuove tecnologie.
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese.


Soft Skill e formazione:


Capacit√† di comunicazione dei progetti attraverso presentazioni e report.
Conoscenza del linguaggio SQL.
Conoscenza di DB vettoriali.
Esperienza di cloud computing (AWS, Google Cloud o MS Azure).
Esperienza con strumenti di version control del codice (Git).
Capacit√† di utilizzo di notebook (Jupyter, Colab, etc.).
Esperienza in ambito MLOps.
PhD in Computer Science, Fisica, Matematica, Statistica o affini, con utilizzo di Machine Learning (Nice to have).
Esperienza su progetti reali, in contesto accademico o aziendale (tesi, tirocini, stage), in ambito Machine Learning (NLP, Computer Vision, Time Series Forecasting).


Altre informazioni:

L‚Äôofferta prevede un contratto a tempo indeterminato, con una RAL ed un inquadramento commisurati sulla base dell‚Äôesperienza maturata.

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
Are you interested in working with a leading education technology player, the global leader in the assessment and certification of professional skills industry with a presence in more than 200 countries worldwide? If so, this is the chance to apply now! üì•

PeopleCert is looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join the relevant team and work directly alongside data scientists to identify patterns for software optimization, cost reduction, services improvement, data monetization, and market analysis. You will work with key stakeholders such as Sales & Marketing, Finance, and Accounting, Procurement and Logistics, Security, Operations, and Software Development leadership.

As a Junior Data Scientist, your tasks will include the following:


Collaborating with business units to fully understand and define the problem scope, establish requirements and suggest solutions
Bringing data products to life by developing, training and evaluating AI models to be integrated into production workflows
Working closely with other data scientists and data engineers to develop scalable solutions and facilitate knowledge sharing
Educating key stakeholders on understanding the models and methodologies employed, as well as on interpreting the outcomes
Contributing to the data science roadmap of the AI Engineering team
Staying up to date with the latest best practices in Python programming and software development
Performing code reviews, documenting processes and ensuring our internal wiki is up to date



What we look for:


Proven professional experience in predictive analytics, along with applying machine learning techniques in a business context
BSc or MSc in Data Science, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Physics or related field
Solid experience with the Python ecosystem, its machine learning and data science libraries (sklearn, keras, pandas, numpy) as well as proficiency with version control and relational databases (SQL)
In-depth knowledge of machine learning algorithms and their theoretical foundation
Experience in delivering end-to-end projects with clean, reproducible code, detailed comments and comprehensive documentation
Proactive and capable of independently taking initiatives without extensive direction. A problem solver with a strong sense of ownership and emphasis on quality
Experience with cloud platforms and technologies, particularly MS Azure and Databricks is a great plus.
Experience with Natural Language Processing will be considered a plus
Familiarity with big data technologies, such as PySpark and NoSQL databases (Cosmos DB) as well as REST APIs will be appreciated
Excellent command of the English language.



What we offer:


Competitive remuneration package
Work in an international, dynamic and fun atmosphere
Two free vouchers for all certifications from PeopleCert's Portfolio per year for all employees
Complimentary coffee and tea in all our premises
Huge learning experience in using best practices and global environment
Constant personal and professional development



If you want to become a member of our international, dynamic and agile team that creates world leading software products, then we should certainly like to hear from you!

About PeopleCert

PeopleCert is a global leader in assessment and certification of professional skills, partnering with multi-national organizations and government bodies for the development & delivery of standardized exams. Delivering exams across 200 countries and in 25 languages over its state-of-the-art assessment technology, PeopleCert enables professionals to boost their careers and realize their life ambitions.

Quality, Innovation, Passion, Integrity are the core values which guide everything we do.

Our offices in UK, Greece, and Cyprus boast a culture of diversity, where everyone is different, yet everyone fits in. All of us at PeopleCert are committed to the reflection of the diversity and inclusion of our customers and the communities in which we do business.

Working on Home Office (HO) Secure English Language Tests (SELTs)

Any person who is engaged by PeopleCert to work on the SELT service must undergo a Background Check (the results of which must be acceptable to PeopleCert and the HO) prior to commencing their SELT duties. All SELT personnel will be required to complete a declaration (provided by PeopleCert) where the existence of any criminal record and/or bankruptcy must be declared.


If working on the SELT service in the UK, background checks will include:
If working on the SELT service anywhere in the world (outside of the UK) personnel will undergo background checks that are equivalent to those stated for the UK.
In addition, if personnel are required to speak to SELT candidates they must be appropriately skilled in English language and, where SELT services are provided anywhere in the world (outside of the UK), the official language of the relevant country

All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.

Title: Junior Data Scientist (Remote)
Description:
Embark on a career in data science with Kreativstorm, a leading management-consulting firm based in Berlin, Germany. Work remotely with our multinational team and turn data into actionable insights!

Are you passionate about data and eager to uncover insights that drive business decisions? Kreativstorm is looking for a Junior Data Scientist to join our team. You will analyze and interpret complex datasets, develop predictive models, and collaborate with the data team to extract insights. This role offers an excellent opportunity to develop your analytical skills and make a significant impact.

Job Overview and Details:


Location: Fully Remote
Position: Full-Time


Requirements

Ideal Candidates:


Pursuing or having a degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Junior data scientists with a strong interest in data analysis and machine learning.
Proficiency in data science tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, R).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.


Your Role:


Analyze and interpret complex datasets.
Develop predictive models and machine learning algorithms.
Collaborate with the data team to extract insights and inform decisions.
Document and present data science findings.
Support in implementing data-driven solutions.


Benefits

Why Join Us? Kreativstorm offers a dynamic and innovative environment. You will work with a team of data experts, gaining hands-on experience in data science and machine learning. We value creativity, collaboration, and data-driven decision-making. Join us to enhance your data science skills and contribute to the success of our clients.

Apply now and pave the way for your future in data science!

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Job Brief:

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Data Scientist to join our dynamic team at VentureDive. The ideal candidate will have over four years of hands-on experience in data science and machine learning, with a strong focus on time series forecasting and modeling what-if scenarios. You will work primarily with Microsoft Azure technologies, and a background in Consumer-Packaged Goods (CPG) will be highly advantageous.

VentureDive Overview:

Founded in 2012 by veteran technology entrepreneurs from MIT and Stanford, VentureDive is the fastest growing technology company in the region that develops and invests in products and solutions that simplify and improve the lives of people world-wide. We aspire to create a technology organization and an entrepreneurial ecosystem in the region that is recognized as second to none in the world.

Key Responsibilities:


Develop and implement advanced time series forecasting models to predict trends and outcomes
Utilize Microsoft Azure for deploying and managing machine learning models
Conduct thorough data analysis/RCA to support business decisions and strategies
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and deliver insights
Mentor junior data scientists and provide guidance on best practices and methodologies
Ensure the ethical use of data in all projects and maintain high standards of data integrity
Work independently on complex projects with minimal supervision, demonstrating strong problem-solving skills
Be able to support the business unit across multiple projects where required
Able to come up with hypothesis to test models and understand requirements from a business perspective
Research upcoming trends and technologies to make improvements to the workings of the department


Required Qualifications:


Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field
Minimum of 4 years of professional experience in data science
Deep understanding of statistics and how ML algorithms work under the hood
Extensive experience with time series forecasting and modeling scenarios
Strong programming skills in Python using class and functional code
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or similar
Excellent analytical and problem-solving abilities
Strong communication skills and the ability to convey complex findings to non-technical stakeholders
Demonstrated ability to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously
Commitment to ethical behavior and maintaining high standards of data privacy and security
Ability to learn new technologies and get hands-on with large language models (LLMs), including understanding LLM architecture such as transformers


Preferred Qualifications:


Experience in the Consumer Packaged Goods (CPG) industry
Hands on experience of fine-tuning open sourced and closed sourced LLMS such as Llama, OpenAI and others
Familiarity with big data technologies such as Hadoop or Spark
Proficiency in Microsoft Azure services and tools


In order to thrive at VentureDive, you

‚Ä¶are intellectually smart and curious

‚Ä¶have the passion for and take pride in your work

‚Ä¶deeply believe in VentureDive‚Äôs mission, vision, and values

‚Ä¶have a no-frills attitude

‚Ä¶are a collaborative team player

‚Ä¶are ethical and honest

Are you ready to put your ideas into products and solutions that will be used by millions?

You will find VentureDive to be a quick pace, high standards, fun and a rewarding place to work at. Not only will your work reach millions of users worldwide, you will also be rewarded with competitive salaries and benefits. If you think you have what it takes to be a VenDian, come join us ... we're having a ball!

Title: Data Scientist (All Levels)
Description:
Data Scientist (All Levels)

‚Ç¨40,000 to ‚Ç¨80,000

Lisbon ‚Äì visit the office x3 days a week




Xcede are delighted to be working with one of the world‚Äôs largest gaming companies on the scale-up of their pre-existing Data Science & Machine Learning Division. The organisation have an enviable wealth of digital / B2C data available to them given the scale of their userbase. The company would like to capitalise further on this, hence their ambitious (but well-defined) hiring plans.




The company is looking to hire experienced Data Scientists at a couple of different levels ‚Äì Data Scientist / Senior Data Scientist / Principal Data Scientist. Projects will focus on Recommender Systems / Recommendation Engines, Customer Personalisation, etc.




The company have already made some heavyweight appointments, with the ML Leadership team coming from a number of FAANG organisations. This is a fantastic environment to improve your skillset and encounter new ideas.







Requirements

An academic background in Statistics, Mathematics, or Computer Science (or similar)
A number of years of commercial experience as a data scientist appropriate to your grade.
Commercial experience in designing impactful machine learning models
Experience in helping to take said models to production / deployment
Python expertise proven by writing production quality code




Bonus Requirements

System / Recommender System / Recommendation Engine / RecSys experience
PySpark experience
Azure DataBricks experience







Unfortunately sponsorship is not provided for this role




If you are interested please apply here or reach out to morgan.beck@xcede.com

The company is looking to hire experienced Data Scientists at a couple of different levels ‚Äì Data Scientist / Senior Data Scientist / Principal Data Scientist. Projects will focus on Recommender Systems / Recommendation Engines, Customer Personalisation, etc.


The company have already made some heavyweight appointments, with the ML Leadership team coming from a number of FAANG organisations. This is a fantastic environment to improve your skillset and encounter new ideas.



Requirements

  • An academic background in Statistics, Mathematics, or Computer Science (or similar)
  • A number of years of commercial experience as a data scientist appropriate to your grade.
  • Commercial experience in designing impactful machine learning models
  • Experience in helping to take said models to production / deployment
  • Python expertise proven by writing production quality code


Bonus Requirements

  • System / Recommender System / Recommendation Engine / RecSys experience
  • PySpark experience
  • Azure DataBricks experience



Unfortunately sponsorship is not provided for this role


If you are interested please apply here or reach out to morgan.beck@xcede.com

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

To create revolutionary, story-driven RPGs which go straight to the hearts of gamers ‚Äî this is our mission. Want to dive deeper into our company‚Äôs culture? Explore our social media and check out our YouTube channel where we share behind-the-scenes insights and stories direct from our team members!

, Job Description

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our team in Warsaw! You will be part of a team that aims to bring engine, game development tools and gameplay systems to the next level. That means working with various data structures and formats, creating neural networks, innovating together with our internal teams and collaborating with world‚Äôs top-tier tech companies.

If you are passionate about games and AI, we encourage you to apply.

Daily Responsibilities


Analysis and interpretation of complex data from games including engine data, storage formats, telemetry and performance metrics.
Designing and implementing statistical and machine learning models.
Collaborating with data engineers, ML engineers and game developers to understand problems and create new solutions.
Conducting A/B experiments and hypothesis testing to assist in decision-making related to game development.
Implementing predictive models into production environments, then monitoring and optimizing their performance post-deployment.


, Qualifications


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proven experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar analytical role, preferably within the gaming industry.
Experience with LLMs.
Experience with Reinforcement Learning.
Experience with Symbolic AI would be a plus.
Familiarity with data visualization tools.
Proficiency in Python; C++ would be a plus.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Strong collaboration skills and the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Experience with data analysis, statistical modeling, and machine learning techniques.
Experience with implementing and optimizing predictive models in a production environment.
Proactive and self-motivated with a passion for learning and innovation.
Knowledge of cloud platforms and services related to data science and machine learning (e.g., AWS, Google Cloud).
A genuine passion for games and an understanding of the gaming industry.


Additional Information

Relocation support


Relocation package ‚Äì flight ticket, company apartment for your first month, relocating your pet, shipping your belongings: it‚Äôs all covered.
Relocation assistance ‚Äî processing your legalization operations for you, assistance with finding residence, tax settlements - all you need to feel right at home is taken care of.
Polish lessons for foreign employees ‚Äî and for your spouse or partner, too.
Paid Leave ‚Äî from 20 to 26 days of holiday for every team member per year, paid sick leave, and paid maternity & paternity leave.


Perks & Professional Growth


Flexible working hours ‚Äî start your workday anytime between 8:00 and 10:00 AM.
Trainings, lectures and courses ‚Äî internal workshops, external training for each employee, ‚ÄòMeet a star‚Äô events, knowledge-sharing initiatives, online tutorials, and e-learning classes are all available. There‚Äôs always something to learn!
REDs have access to the cafeteria platform through which they can receive subscription benefits, additional medical packages or vouchers and codes to shops and cinemas.
Merch ‚Äî gifts for newborn rebels and regular chances to nab some cool swag!
A welcome pack filled with goodies ‚Äî to help you feel right at home once you join the team


Health & Well-being


Private medical healthcare ‚Äî a selection of medical plans with dental care to choose from, which are also accessible for your partner and relatives.
Health checks ‚Äî tests and vaccinations at the studio as well as professional advice and guidance from a specialist doctor.
Psychological care ‚Äî free mental health support and various well-being webinars.
Multisport card ‚Äî gain access to a wide number of sporting and fitness facilities across the city.


Social Activities & Life in the Office


Dog-friendly office ‚Äî dog owner? Bring your pooch with you and look after them while working! There‚Äôs always a furry friend or two to meet at the studio.
Social events ‚Äî we host regular gatherings at the studio where we can all unwind, play games, and just have some fun together.
Healthy selections ‚Äî organic fruit, snacks, muesli, organic honey, vegan milk, and speciality coffee are all at your disposal around the studio. Enjoy!
Truly international working environment ‚Äî a chance to meet and work with a diverse selection of people from all around the world.


If you've observed any irregularities in our recruitment process please clickhereto report them.

Et pour favoriser ce partage avec d'autres passionn√©s, nous sommes sponsors, speakers, et h√¥tes de diff√©rents √©v√©nements, meetups, et associations de la sc√®ne Tech en France. Business

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
‚ö°Ô∏è What We Do

Swiftly gaining ground as Sweden‚Äôs industry leader in battery storage and expanding rapidly in selected European markets, Flower is on a mission to enable the energy system of tomorrow.

With industry-leading AI software at its core, our service includes stabilizing the energy system by enhancing predictability and flexibility for both energy producers and consumers. By combining pioneering technology with a portfolio of flexible energy assets, we break new ground towards a fossil-free energy system, allowing clean energy to power society.

üåüThe Team

We're committed to shaping tomorrow's energy system with flexible power at its core. Our ambitious team shares a common goal, working together to create a sustainable future. We are now looking for a passionate and skilled Data Scientist based in Stockholm to fulfill that goal with us.

üë©‚Äçüíª About The Role

As a Data Scientist at Flower, you'll play a pivotal role in leveraging data to drive our sustainable energy initiatives forward. Your work will involve analyzing complex datasets, developing models, and generating insights that can propel our green energy transformation.

Key Responsibilities


Analyze and interpret complex datasets to generate insights and support decision-making.
Develop and implement advanced models for predictive and prescriptive analytics.
Create data visualizations and dashboards to communicate findings and recommendations effectively.
Manage data resources, ensuring data quality and accessibility for analysis.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define data requirements and deliver solutions.
Contribute to the development and execution of data-driven strategies and initiatives.


Qualifications


A degree in a relevant topic
A master‚Äôs degree or higher is desirable
Proven experience in data analysis and model development
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R
Knowledge of databases and data management tools
Excellent communication skills for effective collaboration and data storytelling
A detail-oriented mindset and a passion for problem-solving
Experience in the energy sector is advantageous


üìç Location

We value office collaboration but support some hybride work. Our office is at S√∂der M√§larstrand, minutes away from Gamla Stan subway station in Stockholm.

üõí Apply

To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter highlighting your relevant experience and why you feel you would be a great addition to our team.

Our corporate language is English, as we have over 20 nationalities in the office, so we want you to submit your CV in English.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (Paris or Remote France)
Description:
About the job

Our global mission is to enable Alma to grow quickly and securely by anticipating and preventing any risks that could endanger the company. In a nutshell, this means:


Building tools and processes that allow us to accurately assess the risk level of our merchants during onboarding and throughout the entire relationship
Continuously improving our customer scoring model with the objective of offering a frictionless payment experience while minimising defaults and maximising client acceptance
Preventing and thwarting any fraud attempts from our clients or merchants


About the mission

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will join the AI/ML team (part of the Risk Modelling team). You will be responsible for developing and deploying ML models used in our real-time credit risk evaluation, which are at the core of Alma's mission to offer a frictionless payment experience while minimising defaults and maximising client acceptance.

Joining forces with the team, you will:


Own the entire Machine Learning lifecycle, from data collection to model development, deployment in production and follow-up of the monitoring pipeline of our ML products
Leverage ML algorithms and statistical methods to iteratively improve the performance of our credit scoring and extend its capabilities
Collaborate closely with multiple teams to ensure the successful execution of your projects
Understand Alma's business model and proactively identify new opportunities to leverage AI within other teams
Follow ML research, learn new techniques, and apply them to drive business impact
Share your knowledge and expertise with your teammates and Almakers


Over the course of your experiments and deployments, your impact on customer experience and our bottom line will be significant and easily observable.

About you

What would make you a good fit for the role:


Minimum a confirmed full-time permanent experience (internships & apprenticeships excluded) in machine learning with a master's degree in a relevant field (computer science, machine learning, mathematics, engineering, etc.)
Solid understanding of ML fundamentals, including algorithms and concepts such as data leakage, bias-variance tradeoff, under/over-fitting, etc.
Production-level development experience in Python and SQL: unit testing, versioning (git), and documenting your code
Proficiency with cloud computing platforms (preferably GCP)
Advanced analytical skills, with the ability to deep-dive into a problem and quickly deliver pragmatic, tangible results, without getting lost in unnecessarily complex reasoning
Autonomy and ownership on complex projects, capable of getting out of your comfort zone while staying focused, prioritising and communicating in a context of uncertainty
Energetic and enthusiastic team player with very good communication skills
Mandatory full professional proficiency in both French and English


What would make you stand out of the crowd:


Hands-on experience with container-based deployments (Docker, etc.)
Experience interacting with graph databases
Experience in credit scoring or the BNPL ("Buy Now Pay Later") industry
Overall knowledge of the entire ML application lifecycle, from research to production use


ML Stack: Python, FastAPI, VertexAI, BigQuery, PostgreSQL, Github, scikit-learn

About the recruitment process


Phone interview with Recruiter (30 mins)
Technical interview with Senior MLE (30 mins)
Applied ML / Python interview (60 mins)
ML system design interview (60 mins)
Final interview with Head of Risk Modelling (60 mins)

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (F/M)
Description:
At T-Systems, you will find groundbreaking projects that contribute to social and ecological well-being. We want to welcome new talents like you, who bring fresh ideas, different perspectives, embrace challenges, and are committed to continuous learning in order to grow and make an impact on society... all in a fun way!




It doesn't matter when or where you work. It's about doing meaningful work that advances society. For this reason, we will do everything possible to ensure that you have all the development opportunities by providing a support network, excellent technology, a new work environment, and the freedom to work autonomously. We support you in growing both personally and professionally so that you can make a notable impact on society.




T-Systems is a team of around 28,000 employees worldwide, making us one of the leading global providers of end-to-end integrated solutions. We develop hybrid cloud solutions, artificial intelligence, and drive the digital transformation of companies, industries, the public sector, and ultimately, society as a whole.




Job Description

Machine Learning Engineer for Natural Language Understanding and Large Language Models

Skills in Machine learnings tasks: Prompt Engineering, fine-tunning LLMs, Models Serving and Testing, Software Engineering in Python




Primary

Prompt Engineering,
Fine-tunning LLMs,
Models Serving and Testing,
Software Engineering in Python

Secondary:

Familiarity with AWS tech stack
Docker
gitlab
Pytorch, Keras knowledge

Depuis 2012, Mirakl accompagne les entreprises B2C et B2B avec la technologie la plus avanc√©e, s√©curis√©e et √©volutive leur permettant de digitaliser leur activit√© et d'√©largir leur offre via la marketplace ou le dropship, faciliter la gestion des catalogues et des paiements de leurs fournisseurs pour plus d'efficacit√©, offrir une exp√©rience d'achat personnalis√©e √† leurs clients, et augmenter leurs profits gr√¢ce au retail media. Bas√©e √† Paris et Boston, Mirakl est certifi√©e Great Place to Work.

A propos de Mirakl Labs

Nos √©quipes techniques et produits, nomm√©es Mirakl Labs, sont principalement r√©parties entre nos 2 hubs situ√©s √† Paris et √† Bordeaux. Elles collaborent au quotidien afin d'adresser les probl√©matiques de nos clients et utilisateurs en r√©pondant √† diff√©rents challenges li√©s aux nouvelles fonctionnalit√©s, √† la scalabilit√©, la s√©curit√© et l'ergonomie‚Ä¶

Elles op√®rent en mode agile et s'organisent en Squads compos√©es d'un Squad Lead, de 5 d√©veloppeurs, d'un Product Manager et d'un QA. Chaque Squad est sp√©cialis√©e sur un scope fonctionnel afin de concevoir et r√©aliser de nouvelles features, leurs √©volutions et des APIs (avec un d√©coupage en micro-services). Nos √©quipes Infrastructure, Architecture, S√©curit√©, Documentation, Product Design, Data et Support op√®rent en transverse en apportant leur expertise et de la coh√©rence sur l'ensemble des produits.

Toutes les √©quipes sont responsables de leur p√©rim√®tre et chacun des collaborateurs apporte son exp√©rience et ses id√©es. Innovation, feedback et implication dans les prises de d√©cision sont au c≈ìur de notre philosophie.

Et pour favoriser ce partage avec d'autres passionn√©s, nous sommes sponsors, speakers, et h√¥tes de diff√©rents √©v√©nements, meetups, et associations de la sc√®ne Tech en France. Au cours des derni√®res ann√©es, nous avons particip√© √† des √©v√©nements tels que Devoxx, ReactEurope, ProductConf et Flupa UX Days.

A propos du job

Que vous soyez junior ou senior, le poste sera √©volutif pour s'adapter √† votre exp√©rience !

Int√©gr√©(e) dans notre √©quipe Data Science, votre principale mission sera de prototyper, it√©rer, et mettre en production des algorithmes en collaboration avec les √©quipes Produit, les Data Engineers et les √©quipes de d√©veloppement. Les sujets que vous traiterez auront un vrai impact sur nos clients : l'ambition est d'exploiter au maximum nos donn√©es riches et vari√©es afin de d√©velopper leur chiffre d'affaires, d'optimiser la gestion op√©rationnelle de leur marketplace et de garantir la s√©curit√© des utilisateurs et des transactions.

A propos de l'√©quipe

  • Get to Know the Data Science Team That Powers the Mirakl Platform

Voici quelques sujets actuels & futurs :

  • Cat√©gorisation de produits
  • Mappings de donn√©es produit
  • Extraction de caract√©ristiques produit √† partir du texte et des images
  • D√©tection de comportements frauduleux
  • Estimation de la date de livraison d'une commande
  • Monitoring de la qualit√© de service des vendeurs
  • Recommandations de produits (upsell, cross-sell, retargeting, ‚Ä¶)
  • Personnalisation des r√©sultats de recherche
  • Personnalisation de l'affichage de contenu
  • Pr√©diction de produits tendance
  • Aide/Suggestion de r√©ponses au customer service
  • Affichage de produits sponsoris√©s ou de publicit√©s maximisant le taux de clic

Ce qu'il y a pour vous dans ce job

  • Impl√©menter des algorithmes qui auront un impact visible sur plus de 500 sites e-commerce/marketplaces dans 40 pays dont certains une volum√©trie tr√®s importantes (millions de produits, de clients, de commandes par an)
  • Des techniques diverses et vari√©es (Heuristiques, Deep Learning, NLP, Image Processing, Time Series, LLM, etc.)
  • Une vraie autonomie et responsabilit√© dans les projets dont vous avez l'ownership
  • La possibilit√© d'avoir un contrat freelance ou CDI

Notre stack et nos outils

Python, Tensorflow, Keras, Pytorch, Databricks, Spark, Aws (Amazon Redshift, s3, etc.), SQL, Airflow, Delta Lake

Au quotidien, vous allez :

  • Analyser, pr√©parer les donn√©es, prototyper des algorithmes
  • Les mettre en production en collaboration avec les Data Engineers et les √©quipes de d√©veloppement
  • Faire des dashboards afin d'illustrer la pertinence des algorithmes et de monitorer la production
  • Pr√©senter les r√©sultats au weekly data science
  • Participer aux sessions de brainstorming de l'√©quipe
  • √âchanger avec les autres √©quipes pour affiner les cas d'utilisation, l'exp√©rience utilisateur et les modes d'int√©gration

Vous aimerez ce job si :

  • Vous √™tes jeune dipl√¥m√©(e) ou avez 4 √† 5 ans d'exp√©rience minimum en tant que Data Scientist, avec une exp√©rience significative en machine learning appliqu√© en entreprise
  • Vous avez d√©j√† mis en production des algorithmes de Machine Learning
  • Vous avez une bonne connaissance des algorithmes de Deep Learning (image et/ou texte) et des architectures State-Of-the-Art - par exemple les Transformers
  • Vous ma√Ætrisez Python, Tensorflow ou/et PyTorch
  • Vous avez une exp√©rience en d√©veloppement Spark
  • Vous √™tes pragmatique, data-driven et orient√© m√©tier
  • Vous aimez avoir l'ownership de vos sujets
  • Vous √™tes autonome et avez un tr√®s bon esprit d'√©quipe
  • Vous avez un esprit positif : respect et bienveillance font partie de vos valeurs
  • Vous aimez partager votre travail dans le cadre de pr√©sentations internes, dans des conf√©rences ou en r√©digeant des articles

Petit plus :

  • Vous avez une exp√©rience en environnement e-commerce et sur des algorithmes de syst√®mes de recommandations

Mirakl est engag√©e en faveur de la diversit√©, de l'√©galit√© des chances et de l'inclusion. Nous c√©l√©brons nos diff√©rences car nous sommes convaincus que les qualit√©s visibles et invisibles de chaque Mirakl Worker sont une source de force et d'innovation. Dans le cadre de cet engagement, nous √©tudions toutes les candidatures sans distinction de : genre, ethnicit√©, religion, orientation sexuelle, handicap, √¢ge ou toute autre caract√©ristique prot√©g√©e par la loi.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
üåü Allow us to introduce ourselves:

Ancient Gaming, an innovative software creator for the future of iGaming, bucks the trend that has lacked innovation for two decades.¬†We're not trend followers; we're trendsetters.¬†As iGaming pioneers, we challenge the status quo, crafting not just appealing software but a whole new experience for the innovative, high-spending generation seeking to reinvent gaming interactions.

Founded in 2018 in Malta, we've become a global presence with¬†100+ dedicated team members¬†spanning across¬†30+ countries. And yes, we're proudly remote-first!




üöÄ Your mission as a Data Scientist!

As a Data Scientist, you will play a pivotal role in leveraging data to drive business insights, optimize player experiences, and shape the future of iGaming. You will work closely with cross-functional teams, including product development, marketing, and customer support, to analyze large datasets and provide actionable recommendations. Your work will directly impact our strategic decisions and contribute to our continued growth and success.




You will be working on:

CSGORoll: the world‚Äôs #1 skin gaming site. A community social gaming platform targeted towards CS2 players, featuring unique in-house custom-built games such as Roulette, Crash, Unboxing, and PVP.




What you‚Äôll be doing:

Analyzing and interpreting complex datasets to extract actionable insights and trends.
Developing and implementing data models, algorithms, and statistical techniques to solve business problems and improve player engagement.
Collaborating with product and marketing teams to identify data-driven opportunities and strategies.
Designing and conducting A/B tests to evaluate the impact of new features and changes.
Creating data visualizations and dashboards to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and advancements in data science and machine learning.




You will thrive in this role if you have:

Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
At least 4 years of experience in a data science role within the Gaming/iGaming industry.
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or SQL.
Strong experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Expertise in machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to communicate complex data findings in a clear and concise manner.




What‚Äôs in it for you?

Flexibility Policy¬†‚Äì It's about giving you the freedom to structure your workday in a way that best suits your lifestyle and responsibilities outside of work
Work-from-anywhere Policy¬†‚Äì you have the chance to work from anywhere in the world, we are a remote-first company and we are proud of it!
Every year for our¬†team-building¬†we choose a location and go there to celebrate our achievements together
A¬†dedicated budget¬†to purchase all the equipment you need to set up your home office
L&D budget¬†for you to develop your skills!
Spill Mental Health Service¬†‚Äì full access to counseling for any employees who need it
Innovative, fun, flat structured¬†rapidly growing¬†company with endless opportunities to grow




This post not only outlines our ideal candidate but also serves as an inspiration for what this role can evolve into. Even if you consider yourself an 80% fit but have a genuine passion for this position, we encourage you to apply. We're eager to hear from individuals who share our enthusiasm. Ancient Gaming is an equal-opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who are we:

Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.




We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.




With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.




Neotalent, the responsive people.




Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.




What you will do:

Neotalent is looking for a Data Scientist to join one of the largest software houses based in Lisbon focus on e-sourcing and e-procurement solutions.




As we continue to spearhead digital transformation initiatives, we take pride in introducing cutting-edge AI products that are revolutionizing procurement processes.

Develop custom data models and algorithms using advanced machine learning tools and statistical techniques.
Utilize programming languages like R and Python to conduct comprehensive analysis and modeling.
Apply expertise in statistical analysis and predictive modeling to extract actionable insights from data.
Identify hidden patterns and insights within data to facilitate informed decision-making.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and implement workflows for data extraction, transformation, and loading from diverse sources.
Ensure the integrity and security of data throughout the entire process.




Are you ready for a leap in your career?




What you are like:

At least 2 years of experience as a Data Scientist;
Proven experience in developing and deploying machine learning models in real world settings;
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, R, or Java, coupled with hands-on expertise;
Exceptional problem-solving abilities, enabling effective translation of business requirements into technical solutions.
Professional english proficiency (written and spoken);




Why join us

Work on challenging projects for big clients
Learn more about emerging technologies
Possibility of working remotely
Design your career plan
Access to continuous training and certifications
Evolve through our internal mobility program
‚Ä¶ and much more!

Title: Data Scientist / ML-Engineer
Description:
ALGOTEQUE is an IT consultancy firm that helps startups, mid-sized and large corporations to create and deliver innovative technologies.

Our team has a successful track record in designing, developing, implementing, and integrating software solutions (AI, ML, BI, Web, Automation) for Telecom, Energy, Bank, Insurance, Pharma, Automotive, Industry, e-commerce. We deliver our services both in fixed-price and time-and-materials models, helping our customers achieve their business and IT strategies.

Job Description

Algoteque is seeking a talented Data Scientist / ML-Engineer to join our dynamic team. This role involves working on innovative projects for our clients, focusing on deep learning, model optimization, and production deployment.

Responsibilities

Deep Learning: Utilize deep learning techniques for tasks such as image, text, and video classification using neural networks.

Model Development: Collaborate with the team to develop, train, and research new and existing machine learning models.

ML-Ops: Implement and maintain ML-Ops practices to ensure models are effectively brought into production.

Data Science Ecosystem: Utilize the Python data science ecosystem, including tools like pandas and numpy, to analyze and manipulate data.

Feedback Loops: Develop and implement feedback loops to generate new training data as part of the machine learning lifecycle.

Best Practices: Apply best practices in machine learning and data science to ensure robust and reliable models.

Profile / Requirements

Deep Learning: Experience with deep learning frameworks such as PyTorch and Tensorflow.

Python: Proficiency in Python and familiarity with its data science ecosystem, including pandas and numpy.

Statistics: Solid foundations in statistics to support data analysis and model validation.

ML-Ops: Experience in ML-Ops, including bringing models into production and maintaining them.

Production Models: Proven experience in implementing and optimizing machine learning models for production environments.

Problem-Solving: Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently on complex tasks.

Preferred Qualities

Innovative Thinker: Ability to think creatively and propose innovative solutions to complex problems.

Team Collaboration: Strong collaboration skills to work effectively with other team members and stakeholders.

Continuous Learning: Commitment to staying updated with the latest developments in machine learning and data science.

What We Offer

Innovative Projects: Opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects for leading clients.

Professional Growth: Continuous learning and development opportunities.

Flexible Work Environment: Remote work.

If you are a dedicated Data Scientist / ML-Engineer with a passion for deep learning and model optimization, we would love to hear from you.

AO2901

Title: Biological Data Scientist
Description:
Company Description

The Company

Syngenta is a leading developer and producer of seeds. We bring farmers more vigorous, stronger, resistant plants, including innovative hybrid varieties and biotech crops that can thrive even in challenging growing conditions. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity‚Äôs most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture.

For a new opening in the team, we are looking for a:

Biological Data Scientist

Job Description

Into Action

Are you ready to make a significant impact in the agricultural industry? Look no further! The Vegetable Seed Enhancement Team (VSET) at Syngenta is seeking a highly motivated and talented Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. As a Data Scientist at VSET, you will be an integral part of a multidisciplinary team, working closely with stakeholders across the vegetable business. Your primary focus will be on designing and implementing imaging technologies, algorithms, and artificial intelligence systems. By automating measurements and leveraging AI, you will gain a deep understanding of seed physiology and develop data-based solutions for the challenges faced by the global vegetable business.

The Challenge

When you are established in your role, you will work with the VSET team to;


Automate seed and plant measurements, developing algorithms for predicting seed performance.
Combine expertise in image analysis, machine learning, seed physiology, and biological experimentation.
Lead implementation and technology transfer to processing sites.
Actively participate in Syngenta's network of imaging and AI technologies.


Qualifications

Your Profile


To succeed in this role, you preferably have a Ph.D. or MSc degree with 3+ years of experience in machine learning and artificial intelligence or equivalent qualifications.
You are familiar with machine/deep learning frameworks, such as TensorFlow, Keras, and PyTorch.
Experience in deploying image analysis pipelines on the edge or in the cloud would be advantageous.
It would be a big plus if you have a strong interest in developing skills in chemometrics, spectroscopy, hyperspectral imaging, and establish a strong basic understanding of seed and plant biology.
You have good communication skills to interact with diverse internal stakeholders.
You are willing to work in Enkhuizen on a fulltime basis.


We will take care of a great onboarding, to make sure you feel comfortable and have all the necessary tools to start your new challenge.

Additional Information

Your Chance!

Join us at Syngenta and be part of a diverse and inclusive team that is passionate about shaping the future of sustainable agriculture. We offer a competitive salary package, excellent benefits and ample opportunities for professional growth and development.

If you recognize yourself in the profile and would like to apply for this position, please apply online via www.syngenta.com If you would like to have more information about this vacancy please contact our recruiter Nienke Terluin by email to nienke.terluin@syngenta.com
Show more
HTML:
Company Description

The Company

Syngenta is a leading developer and producer of seeds. We bring farmers more vigorous, stronger, resistant plants, including innovative hybrid varieties and biotech crops that can thrive even in challenging growing conditions. Each of our 28,000 employees in more than 90 countries work together to solve one of humanity‚Äôs most pressing challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. A diverse workforce and an inclusive workplace environment are enablers of our ambition to be the most collaborative and trusted team in agriculture.

For a new opening in the team, we are looking for a:

Biological Data Scientist

Job Description

Into Action

Are you ready to make a significant impact in the agricultural industry? Look no further! The Vegetable Seed Enhancement Team (VSET) at Syngenta is seeking a highly motivated and talented Data Scientist to join our dynamic team. As a Data Scientist at VSET, you will be an integral part of a multidisciplinary team, working closely with stakeholders across the vegetable business. Your primary focus will be on designing and implementing imaging technologies, algorithms, and artificial intelligence systems. By automating measurements and leveraging AI, you will gain a deep understanding of seed physiology and develop data-based solutions for the challenges faced by the global vegetable business.

The Challenge

When you are established in your role, you will work with the VSET team to;

  • Automate seed and plant measurements, developing algorithms for predicting seed performance.
  • Combine expertise in image analysis, machine learning, seed physiology, and biological experimentation.
  • Lead implementation and technology transfer to processing sites.
  • Actively participate in Syngenta's network of imaging and AI technologies.

Qualifications

Your Profile

  • To succeed in this role, you preferably have a Ph.D. or MSc degree with 3+ years of experience in machine learning and artificial intelligence or equivalent qualifications.
  • You are familiar with machine/deep learning frameworks, such as TensorFlow, Keras, and PyTorch.
  • Experience in deploying image analysis pipelines on the edge or in the cloud would be advantageous.
  • It would be a big plus if you have a strong interest in developing skills in chemometrics, spectroscopy, hyperspectral imaging, and establish a strong basic understanding of seed and plant biology.
  • You have good communication skills to interact with diverse internal stakeholders.
  • You are willing to work in Enkhuizen on a fulltime basis.

We will take care of a great onboarding, to make sure you feel comfortable and have all the necessary tools to start your new challenge.

Additional Information

Your Chance!

Join us at Syngenta and be part of a diverse and inclusive team that is passionate about shaping the future of sustainable agriculture. We offer a competitive salary package, excellent benefits and ample opportunities for professional growth and development.

If you recognize yourself in the profile and would like to apply for this position, please apply online via www.syngenta.com If you would like to have more information about this vacancy please contact our recruiter Nienke Terluin by email to nienke.terluin@syngenta.com

üß† Il Nostro Impegno per l'Innovazione:

Investiamo in modo significativo in Intelligenza Artificiale (AI) per ottimizzare la gestione e valutazione dei dati;

Siamo leader nell'outsourcing di processi di dati e comunicazione multicanale

Lavorerai a stretto contatto con il Responsabile Planning & Control, il CFO e il team di Controllo di gestione e Dati. Inoltre, avrai l‚Äôopportunit√† di collaborare con colleghi esperti provenienti da diverse aree, come sviluppatori, DevOps, visual engineer e business developer. Per progetti specifici, potrai anche contare sull'assistenza di consulenti esterni, che ti aiuteranno a raggiungere gli obiettivi prefissati.

Supporto nell'implementazione di un nuovo ERP, dalla migrazione dei dati alla definizione delle nuove logiche di approvvigionamento, mantenimento dei dati e creazione di un nuovo datalake/DBWH, fino all'analisi e restituzione dei dati.

üñ•Ô∏è Qualifiche e Competenze Richieste

Laurea in Matematica, Statistica, Data Analysis, o discipline STEM.
Esperienza di 2-3 anni nel ruolo.
Buona padronanza della lingua inglese.




üéØNice to have

Conoscenza di Python.
Esperienza in migrazione di sistemi ERP e lavoro su piattaforme moderne per la gestione dei dati (Synapse/Fabric).




üåüLe Soft Skills che riteniamo importanti

Precisione e affidabilit√†.
Pensiero critico e passione per l‚Äôanalisi finanziaria.

Proattivit√†, flessibilit√† e capacit√† di risoluzione dei problemi.




üìç Sede di lavoro: Milano (MI), ibrido.
